message.content:
cs.CL, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.NE, cs.CV. 

This paper is about a neural model for recognizing nested mentions in text. The model uses a shift-reduce algorithm and a Stack-LSTM to construct a forest structure of mentions in a bottom-up manner. This involves learning to predict actions that add or merge mentions in the forest. The model also incorporates a character-based component to capture letter-level patterns. Given these characteristics, the most likely sub-category is cs.CL (Computation and Language), which covers natural language processing and computational linguistics. Other likely sub-categories include cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence), cs.LG (Machine Learning), cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing), and cs.CV (Computer Vision), as these areas also involve neural models and learning algorithms.
